questions.text: Which hormone stimulates reabsorption of urea in the collecting duct?

options.text: atrial natriuretic hormone (ANH)
parathormone (PTH)
arginine-vasopressin (ADH)
aldosterone

questions.text: At which plasma glucose concentration does the glucose appear in the urine (renal threshold)?

options.text: 5-6 mmol/L
11-13 mmol/L
5-6 mmol/L
there is never glucose in the urine

questions.text: The plasma glucose concentration when glucose first appears in the urine (renal threshold) is

options.text: above 20-22 mmol/L
between 10 and 12 mmol/L
between 4 and 6 micromol/L
between 6 and 8 mmol/L
between 15 and 20 mmol/L

questions.text: The renal recirculation of urea

options.text: involves urea reabsorption by the intercalated cells
is a mechanism contributing to the creation the osmotic gradient in the medulla
promotes the excretion of dilute urine
is inhibited by vasopressin
is stimulated by vasopressin
requires UT-1 transporters in the thin segment of the loop of Henle

questions.text: It is characteristic of protein transport in the nephron that (S)

options.text: proteins are filtered with perfect ease in the glomeruli
proteins are not filtered at all in the glomeruli
proteins are secreted in the tubules
proteins are taken up from the tubular fluid and are digested by the epithelial cells
the reabsorbed proteins are transferred into the interstitial fluid
protein transport is linked to sodium reabsorption
none of the above is correct

questions.text: The tubular maximum for glucose (M)

options.text: corresponds to a plasma glucose concentration of about 10 mmol/liter
characterizes the tubular glucose transport capacity
is the threshold concentration for excretion of glucose in the urine
is the maximum concentration of glucose in the glomerular filtrate which is completely reabsorbed
is the tubular load of glucose above which the glucose concentration in the urine varies linearly with the glucose concentration in the plasma

questions.text: It is characteristic of glucose excretion that (M)

options.text: glucose is not filtered in the glomeruli
glucose is secreted in the proximal tubules
glucose transport has a tubular maximum
the glucose tubular maximum is the tubular glucose concentration threshold where glucose is excreted in the urine
the concentration of glucose in the glomerular filtrate is the same as the concentration of glucose in the plasma
the clearance of glucose is higher than the clearance of sodium

questions.text: It is characteristic of glucose excretion that (M)

options.text: glucose is filtered with perfect ease in the glomeruli
glucose is secreted in the proximal tubules
glucose is secreted in the distal tubules
the clearance for glucose is zero
the clearance for glucose is 120 ml/min
glucose transport is linked to protein reabsorption

questions.text: Which of the following statements are correct? (M)

options.text: glucose is filtered without restrictions in the glomeruli
the blood perfusing the glomeruli is completely free of inulin
glucose is secreted in the proximal tubules
amino acids are reabsorbed by an active mechanism coupled to sodium transport
the thick segment is the major site for passive urea reabsorption
secretion of water requires ADH

questions.text: Find the substance that is passively reabsorbed from the proximal tubule

options.text: urea
sodium
amino acids
glucose

questions.text: It is characteristic of protein transport in the nephron that

options.text: proteins are secreted in the tubules
protein transport is linked to sodium reabsorption
proteins are filtered with perfect ease in the glomeruli
proteins are taken up from the tubular fluid and are digested by the epithelial cells
proteins are not filtered at all in the glomeruli
the reabsorbed proteins are transferred into the interstitial fluid

questions.text: Which statement is true concerning the renal excretion of glucose?

options.text: the renal clearance of glucose is approximately 20-30 ml/min under physiological circumstances
at normal fasting blood glucose levels the renal glucose transport is fully saturated
tubular glucose reabsorption is independent of the Na-K pump inhibition, since the transport mechanism of glucose is facilitated diffusion
the hormonal regulation of renal glucose excretion is taking place in the principal cells of the collecting duct
The renal threshold of glucose is the plasma glucose concentration, where the glucose transport is saturated and reaches the Tmax value

questions.text: Find the substance that is passively reabsorbed from the proximal tubule

options.text: albumin
glucose
amino acids
urea

options.text: 22-25 mmol/L
11-13 mmol/L
3-6 mmol/L
there is never glucose in the urine

options.text: albumin

questions.text: Where are the amino acids reabsorbed in the kidney?

options.text: only in the proximal tubule
in the proximal and distal tubules
in the Bowman-capsule
only in the thick segment of the loop of Henle
only in the collecting duct

questions.text: Which statement is true concerning the renal excretion of glucose?

options.text: at normal fasting blood glucose levels the renal glucose transport is fully saturated
the kidney is able to excrete glucose at approximately 20-30 ml/min under physiological circumstances
the hormone vasopressin is renal glucose is taking place in the principal cells of the collecting duct
The renal threshold of glucose is the plasma glucose concentration, where the glucose transport is saturated and reaches the Tmax value.
tubular glucose reabsorption is independent of the Na-K pump inhibition, since the luminal transport mechanism of glucose is facilitated diffusion

questions.text: Osmotic diuresis is often observed in

options.text: diabetes mellitus
after drinking excessive amounts of water
diabetes insipidus
in the case of urinary incontinence

questions.text: The transport of urea in the kidney is such that

options.text: cc. 10 % of excreted urea is secreted in the collecting duct
cc. 10 % of the filtered urea is reabsorbed in the thick segment of the loop of Henle
cc. 50 % of the filtered urea is reabsorbed in the proximal tubule
cc. 10 % of the filtered urea is reabsorbed in the thin segment of the loop of Henle
